com.datamelt.db

Class MySqlConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datamelt.db.MySqlConnection

  • public class MySqlConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    helper class to connect to a MySql database. encapsulates the most often used functions into this simple class. simply instantiate a connection object using one of the constructors. then pass a sql string to the getResultset() methods to get a resultset containing the database records. call the getPreparedStatement() method using a sql string as parameter to get a prepared statement, which in turn can be used to retrieve database records or to update the database.
    Author:
    uwe geercken

    • Constructor Detail

      • MySqlConnection

        public MySqlConnection(java.lang.String hostname,
                       java.lang.String databaseName,
                       int port,
                       java.lang.String userid,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        constructor to create a connection using hostname, databasename, port, userid and password.
        Parameters:
        hostname - hostname or IP adress of the database server
        databaseName - the name of the database to use
        port - the port the database server listens on
        userid - the id of the user - with appropriate right
        password - the password of the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception if the connection can not be established

      • MySqlConnection

        public MySqlConnection(java.lang.String hostname,
                       java.lang.String databaseName,
                       java.lang.String userid,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        constructor to create a connection using hostname, databasename, userid and password. uses the default MySQL port for the connection.
        Parameters:
        hostname - hostname or IP adress of the database server
        databaseName - the name of the database to use
        userid - the id of the user - with appropriate right
        password - the password of the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception if the connection can not be established

      • MySqlConnection

        public MySqlConnection(java.lang.String databaseName,
                       java.lang.String userid,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        constructor to create a connection using databasename, userid and password. uses localhost as hostname and the default MySQL port for the connection.
        Parameters:
        databaseName - the name of the database to use
        userid - the id of the user - with appropriate right
        password - the password of the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception if the connection can not be established

      • MySqlConnection

        public MySqlConnection(java.lang.String hostname,
                       int port,
                       java.lang.String databaseName,
                       java.lang.String userid,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        constructor to create a connection using hostname, port, databaseName, userid and password.
        Parameters:
        hostname - the name of the server where the mysql server runs
        port - the port of the server where the mysql server runs
        databaseName - the name of the database to use
        userid - the id of the user - with appropriate right
        password - the password of the user
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception if the connection can not be established

      • getLastInsertId

        public long getLastInsertId()
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        returns the last_insert_id. this is that id that was last assigned to an autoincrement column of the mysql database. if a record is inserted into a table and the table has an autoincrement column then the id of this autoincrement column will be returned.
        Returns:
        the id of the last inserted record
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception if the last_insert_id could not be evaluated

      • setAutoCommit

        public void setAutoCommit(boolean status)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Sets autocommit to true or false. if set to false, then commit() method has to be used explicitly to write changes to the database
        Parameters:
        status - indicator if autocommit shall be used or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception if autocommit can not be set

      • rollback

        public void rollback()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        rolls back a transaction that has been started. this mean that all changes belonging to this transaction will NOT be applied to the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - exception if the transaction could not be rolled back
